channel.title: Licorice - DCPU-16 emulator
channel.description:
https://github.com/Hadyn/licorice
[i]Not familiar with what 'DCPU-16' is?[/i]
http://dcpu.com/
[i]Not familiar with what '0x10c' is?[/i]
http://0x10c.com
Working on my second emulator. This one should have device support and is oriented more to eventually have a debugging library and support all the devices that Notch creates as time passes. I know I'm going to hear this, lets steer away from arguing about OOOP (overly OOP) when its in this phase. It's meant to be flexible. The DCPU functionality is actually separate from the 'core' library.
If you have followed the 0x10c project, they're making a lot of improvements to the documentation. It'll take awhile to add all the functionality such as interrupts, and all the devices.

item.title: Licorice - DCPU-16 emulator
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Committed all my past updates. The logic still isn’t finished but now the strategy can get the correct instruction target and values.

https://github.com/Hadyn/licorice/commit/f8b0ae532c7347ca042257ae284ed80325ad865d

Read full topic

Yea it used to be a red circle

I thought it went: green for warned, yellow for moderated, orange for muted, and red for banned?
[/quote]Oh yea… that does sound familiar. I still don’t remember the red one, but I do remember mute being orange[/quote]i remember mute as orange as well. i can’t recall red being banned.

item.title: Licorice - DCPU-16 emulator
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Omer, post:2, topic:465393”]https://github.com/Hadyn/licorice/blob/master/src/net/hadyn/licorice/memory/Memory.java
oh god[/quote]

Do you understand what the purpose of having a memory object is for? It’s so that eventually I can implement listeners and pass the ‘Memory’ object to said listener. Like the register (https://github.com/Hadyn/licorice/blob/master/src/net/hadyn/licorice/register/Register.java), the state of a memory object will be considered final and is apart of the design. So shut up you stupid kike.

Read full topic
